meta.desc.choose_mode: Pick a mode, review the rules, and start a Random Chess game with friends, solo, or against the computer.
meta.desc.single_player: Play a local Random Chess game with full card rules and timers.
meta.desc.computer: Challenge Stockfish in Random Chess, adjust skill and timers, and practice tactics.
meta.desc.play_friend: Create or join an online game, share the invite link, and chat live while you play.
meta.desc.history: Browse your past Random Chess games and open full replays.
meta.desc.history_game: Replay a finished game, review the moves, and see the final result.
meta.desc.auth: Sign in or continue as a guest to create online games, save history, and chat with opponents.
meta.desc.not_found: This page does not exist. Return to the main menu to start a new game.
meta.desc.play_index: Start a new online game and get a shareable invite link.
copy_link_instructions: Copy game link and send it to your friend. When they open the link, the game will start
rules.title: Random Chess Rules
rules.point.card: Each turn you draw a card; your move must be legal in chess and satisfy that card.
rules.point.redraw: If no legal move fits the card, a new card is drawn.
rules.detail.rank: Move must start or end on that rank.
rules.detail.file: Move must start or end on that file.
rules.detail.pieces: Move must involve that piece (moving, capturing, or promoting to it for Q/B/R/N).
rules.detail.pawn: Any pawn move (including captures and promotions).
rules.detail.take: The move must capture a piece.
rules.detail.check: The move must give check or checkmate.
rules.detail.stalemate: Move must result in a stalemate position.
rules.detail.castling: Castling allowed if the card matches a castling square (a/b/c/d/e for long, e/f/g/h for short, plus rank 1/8 for your color).
rules.example.rank: Example: card 7 ⇒ play Rd7 or d7-d5
rules.example.file: Example: card e ⇒ play Re1 or e4xd5
rules.example.pieces: Example: card R ⇒ e7-e8=R or Ra1-a8
rules.example.pawn: Example: card p ⇒ e2-e4 or exd5
rules.example.stalemate: Example: card stalemate ⇒ force no legal moves without check
rules.example.any: Example: card any ⇒ any legal move
rules.example.castling: Example: card a or d with 1 ⇒ O-O-O as White; e/f/g/h with 8 ⇒ O-O as Black
skill.label: Skill:
rules.tip: Tip: Think ahead and keep your pieces positioned so they cannot reach risky squares, reducing the chance of being forced into a bad move when a matching card appears.
confirm.resign: Are you sure you want to resign?
auth.reset_password.sent: Password reset email sent. Please check your inbox, follow the instructions, then return to this form and enter the new password.
auth.verify_email.sent: Verification email sent. Please check your inbox, click the link, then return and sign in.
auth.verify_email.prompt: Please verify your email to continue. We just sent you a verification email.
